body_html: The type dispatch registry is filled when the global context is initialized. If we manage to call an op (for example numel()) before this happens, then we'll segfault because we can't dispatch to the correct Type. Usually this doesn't happen because we can't create a tensor without initializing the context, but thpp-compatibility manages to do this because it constructs tensors from TH directly.
body_text: The type dispatch registry is filled when the global context is initialized. If we manage to call an op (for example numel()) before this happens, then we'll segfault because we can't dispatch to the correct Type. Usually this doesn't happen because we can't create a tensor without initializing the context, but thpp-compatibility manages to do this because it constructs tensors from TH directly.
body: The type dispatch registry is filled when the global context is initialized. If we manage to call an op (for example numel()) before this happens, then we'll segfault because we can't dispatch to the correct Type. Usually this doesn't happen because we can't create a tensor without initializing the context, but thpp-compatibility manages to do this because it constructs tensors from TH directly.
